page.title: 01Entrance Loch Fleet, Dornoch
page.content: Before the road was built at the head of Loch Fleet the main route north and south was the ferry between the two headlands. The entrance is very narrow and consequently the tides rip through and are quite dangerous. The houses on the north bank are once again family houses and include the daughter of the last ferryman. There are many walks through the woods, dunes ad sandy beaches. The area is good for birdwatching and is on the edge of a nature reserve. There is one large farm on the south side behind the dunes around the shore. This is a mixed farm, mainly barley, sheep and beef cattle. There is a further plan for a railway bridge across the narrows.
